items.title: How do I force an element to stick to another when using .slideToggle()?
items.body:
Apologies in advance, I am pretty new to all of this.

jsfiddle.net/v1qo4yf0/2/

The triangle serves to show/hide the content with .slideToggle(). It rotates 180 degrees after finishing the animation due to this CSS and jQuery:

.arrow {
       width: 0;
       height: 0;
       border-style: solid;
       position: absolute;
       margin-top: 16px;
}
.upArrow {
       border-width: 0 20px 20px 20px;
       border-color: transparent transparent #3b3738 transparent;
}

.downArrow {
       border-width: 20px 20px 0 20px;
       border-color: #3b3738 transparent transparent transparent;
}

$(".arrow").delay(500).queue(function(run) {
        $(this).toggleClass("upArrow downArrow");
        run();
});

However, if the content has been hidden, and the triangle is clicked to show, it remains above the horizontal line before rotating after the animation has reached the bottom. I would like it to remain upside down as it is but have the base edge of the triangle stay adjacent to the horizontal line. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

items.body_markdown:
I've got a question I can't really answer by myself, behind a NAT, it is possible to do an UDP hole punching by setting manually the "response" port instead of the ephemeral ones, so that you don't have to use an intermediate server? 

I will explain that better, in Java you can choose when creating a socket the port which the client will set in order to receive the response from the server, what if I want to host a server without port forwarding the port 7777 in PC1, could it work if:

**PC1 Server**: Sends an UDP packet using 7777 as source port, to a 7776 port and the destination IP address of the client, so that the NAT expects a connection to 7777, from this IP, obviously this will be rejected, but the NAT doesn't know that, then after sending this packet you can just quickly start a server on the same 7777 port before PC2 sends the response packet I want to send "Manually"

**PC2 Client:** (Can also be behind a NAT): Connects to the server using 7776 as source port, and 7777 as destination, right after PC1 starts the 7777 server before the NAT removes the hole on its table.

If that would work at all, since you have to send those packets at the same time, can that be possible with TCP? I can't even really think to implement that in Java, I'm not that good at programming sockets.
items.title: UDP Hole punch possible without intermediate?
items.body:
I've got a question I can't really answer by myself, behind a NAT, it is possible to do an UDP hole punching by setting manually the "response" port instead of the ephemeral ones, so that you don't have to use an intermediate server?

I will explain that better, in Java you can choose when creating a socket the port which the client will set in order to receive the response from the server, what if I want to host a server without port forwarding the port 7777 in PC1, could it work if:

PC1 Server: Sends an UDP packet using 7777 as source port, to a 7776 port and the destination IP address of the client, so that the NAT expects a connection to 7777, from this IP, obviously this will be rejected, but the NAT doesn't know that, then after sending this packet you can just quickly start a server on the same 7777 port before PC2 sends the response packet I want to send "Manually"

PC2 Client: (Can also be behind a NAT): Connects to the server using 7776 as source port, and 7777 as destination, right after PC1 starts the 7777 server before the NAT removes the hole on its table.

If that would work at all, since you have to send those packets at the same time, can that be possible with TCP? I can't even really think to implement that in Java, I'm not that good at programming sockets.

items.title: How to create a confirmation popup for class.DeleteView
items.body:
I am looking to create a confirmation popup window whenever the delete button is clicked. It currently is functional and immediately deletes. Here is some of my code: views.py:

class patientDelete(LoginRequiredMixin, DeleteView):
    model = patient
    success_url = reverse_lazy('patients:index')

index.html

<form action="{% url 'patients:patient-delete' patient.id %}" method="post" style="display: inline;">
    {% csrf_token %}
    <input type="hidden" name="patient_id" value="{{ patient.id }}" />
    <button type="submit" class="btn btn-default btn-sm">
        <span class="glyphicon glyphicon-trash"></span>
    </button>
</form>

and my urls.py

# /patients/patient/pk/delete
url(r'patient/(?P<pk>[0-9]+)/delete/$', views.patientDelete.as_view(), name='patient-delete'),

I have searched left, right and center and dont really understand most of it. I have been using a lot of tutorials to help me here and am quite new to django. Thanks for your help in advance!

items.body_markdown:
How do I get the OS specific paste menu for a QtQuick.Controls 2* TextField on a right click on selected text.


That works:

    import QtQuick.Controls 1.4

    TextField
    {
        placeholderText: qsTr("Filter")
        selectByMouse: true
    }

and gives me the menu, while

    import QtQuick.Controls 2.2

    TextField
    {
        placeholderText: qsTr("Filter")
        selectByMouse: true
    }

this does nothing on right-click.

I'm using version 5.9 LTS and I'm stuck with it for a while. 

It works neither on Ubuntu Linux 16.04 with 5.9 manually installed nor on Windows 10, mingw{32,64} on msys2.
items.title: OS Edit/Paste menu for Qt Quick.2 TextField
items.body:
How do I get the OS specific paste menu for a QtQuick.Controls 2* TextField on a right click on selected text.

That works:

import QtQuick.Controls 1.4

TextField
{
    placeholderText: qsTr("Filter")
    selectByMouse: true
}

and gives me the menu, while

import QtQuick.Controls 2.2

TextField
{
    placeholderText: qsTr("Filter")
    selectByMouse: true
}

this does nothing on right-click.

I'm using version 5.9 LTS and I'm stuck with it for a while.

It works neither on Ubuntu Linux 16.04 with 5.9 manually installed nor on Windows 10, mingw{32,64} on msys2.

items.title: C++ Common Base Pointer of All Classes Up-casted, Down-casted and Side-casted
items.body:
I have a complex code with several levels of (multiple) inheritance. The algorithm is implemented (without documentation) directly in the code creating a web of dependencies. The basic concept is something like:

class Base;
class Interface;

class A : public Base, public Interface {
  std::vector<child*> children;

  A() {
    auto pbox = new child("Box")
    children.push_back(pbox);
    auto psquare = new child("Square")
    children.push_back(psquare);
    auto pcircle = new child("Circle");
    children.push_back(pcircle);

    global::edge(this, pbox);
    global::edge(this, psquare);
    global::edge(this, pcircle);
  }

  virtual void add_child( child * pchild ) {
    children.push_back(pchild);
    global::edge(this, pchild);
  }

I would like to discover the web of dependencies, by inserting static functions global::edge to map them.

However:

this will resolve differently depending on the cast:

  • dynamic_cast<A*>(this)
  • dynamic_cast<Base*>(this)
  • dynamic_cast<Interface*>(this)

All three will have different values. Is there a way in c++ to cast a pointer to its most 'basic' form? That is to the value which was returned by new?

items.title: Using JButtons to display different images on a Gui
items.body:
I have been trying for a few days to crate a Gui that will change images when I click a different button but I cannot get it to work.

You can see in the picture how its working so far. Ignore the buttons underneath, I am not too concerned about them yet. When someone clicks a button I want there picture to pop up.

There is a Card class and a main class of code that I have not included but cn add if needed. Any help would be great.

package singleTrumps;

import java.awt.*;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;

import javax.swing.*;



public class GUi extends JFrame {   




public GUi(String pName, Cards[] player, int x, int y) {

     JPanel holder = new JPanel();
     JPanel buttonPanel = new JPanel(); 
     JButton[] buttons = new JButton[ 5 ];

     /********************* Create JFrame *********************************/         
     JFrame frame = new JFrame("Game of Thrones Top Trumps");
     frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
     frame.setSize(450, 600);
     frame.setLocation(x, y);


     /*************************** Name And score*********************************/       
     JLabel label1 = new JLabel(pName+ "      Score goes here");
     label1.setFont(new Font("Cooper Black", 20, 20 ));
     JPanel panel = new JPanel();
     panel.add(label1);      
     frame.add(panel, BorderLayout.NORTH);


/**********************************************************************/

     JPanel picturePanel = new JPanel();
     picturePanel.add(displayImage(player[0]));
     picturePanel.setBorder(BorderFactory.createLineBorder(Color.BLACK));
     holder.add(picturePanel, BorderLayout.SOUTH);

     frame.add(holder,BorderLayout.CENTER);

     /************************** Buttons and picture**********************************/


     String temp = null;


     for ( int count = 0; count < player.length; count++ ) {
     buttons[ count ] = new JButton(player[count].name );
     /********************************/

    // buttons[count].addActionListener(new Listener());


     buttonPanel.add( buttons[ count ] );
     }


     holder.add(buttonPanel, BorderLayout.NORTH);







     /**********************  Skills **************************************/


     JPanel skillPanel = new JPanel();

     JButton combat = new JButton("Fighting");
     combat.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(100, 30));
     skillPanel.add(combat);

     JButton speed = new JButton("Speed");       
     speed.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(100, 30));
     skillPanel.add(speed);

     JButton speech = new JButton("Speech");         
     speech.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(100, 30));
     skillPanel.add(speech);

     JButton strength = new JButton("Strength");         
     strength.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(100, 30));
     skillPanel.add(strength);

     frame.add(skillPanel, BorderLayout.SOUTH);


     /************************************************************/

     frame.setVisible(true);
  }




JLabel displayImage(Cards cards) {
    String fill = cards.name;
    ImageIcon image = new ImageIcon("C:\\Users\\gary.kelly\\Pictures\\Cards\\"+ fill+ ".jpg");

    Image im = image.getImage(); 
    Image newimg = im.getScaledInstance(330, 420,  java.awt.Image.SCALE_SMOOTH); // scale it the smooth way  
    ImageIcon pic = new ImageIcon(newimg);

    JLabel imageLabel = new JLabel(pic);    
    return imageLabel;
  }


}

items.title: Bloodhound remote request with wildcard not returning anything?
items.body:
I have an api that given a query, returns a subset of objects available - which I would like bloodhound to use for typeahead:

my-api/?q=<search>

and set up the instance as follows:

var bh = new Bloodhound({
    remote: {
        url: "my-api/?q=%QUERY",
        wildcard: "%QUERY",
        prepare: function(query, settings) {
             settings.url = settings.url.replace("%QUERY", query)
             return settings
        }
    },
    queryTokenizer: Bloodhound.tokenizers.whitespace,
    datumTokenizer: Bloodhound.tokenizers.obj.whitespace
}).initialize()

Where the prepare function seems to be necessary as the wildcard does not seem to be used.

If I copy paste the result of the wildcard replace (from prepare function) I get the json response (list of objects).

However, when I call:

bh.search('test', function(datums){console.log(datums)})

I get the empty array.

I must be missing something obvious. I already looked at several S.O. posts and tried using replace instead of / with prepare. Nothing works.

Assuming that my-api/?q=<query> returns a list of objects, what am I doing wrong?

items.body_markdown:
I have a NodeJS server running within a Docker container. I'm using Docker Toolbox for this, therefore I have a VirtualBox VM that I'm running my container in. My server needs to use a dgram websocket to bind to 0.0.0.0:3000 on the host and listen for data packets there, so I set up port forwarding from 3000->3000 in VirtualBox.

The problem is, when I try and run the applications on the host that are supposed to be publishing data to port 3000, they are not able to bind to the port. 

The error I get is:

    { Error: bind EACCES 0.0.0.0:3000
        at Object.exports._errnoException (util.js:1020:11)
        at exports._exceptionWithHostPort (util.js:1043:20)
        at _handle.lookup (dgram.js:219:18)
        at _combinedTickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:83:11)
        at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:104:9)
        at Module.runMain (module.js:606:11)
        at run (bootstrap_node.js:389:7)
        at startup (bootstrap_node.js:149:9)
        at bootstrap_node.js:504:3
      code: 'EACCES',
      errno: 'EACCES',
      syscall: 'bind',
      address: '0.0.0.0',
      port: 3000 }

If I shut down the VM and run my server outside of the container everything works fine. 

I have my server set up so that it does not have exclusive binding set and reuseAddr is set to true when the websocket is created. This is why when I run it outside of the container there are no binding problems. 

My question is: does port forwarding in VirtualBox do some sort of exclusive binding on the forwarded port? If so, can this be disabled? How can I run my server in a container if this happens?

UPDATE:
I have discovered this only happens when I set VirtualBox to use UDP forwarding. TCP does not cause the issue. Is there any way to do UDP port forwarding and still be able to do port binding?
items.title: VirtualBox port forwarding preventing port binding on host
items.body:
I have a NodeJS server running within a Docker container. I'm using Docker Toolbox for this, therefore I have a VirtualBox VM that I'm running my container in. My server needs to use a dgram websocket to bind to 0.0.0.0:3000 on the host and listen for data packets there, so I set up port forwarding from 3000->3000 in VirtualBox.

The problem is, when I try and run the applications on the host that are supposed to be publishing data to port 3000, they are not able to bind to the port.

The error I get is:

{ Error: bind EACCES 0.0.0.0:3000
    at Object.exports._errnoException (util.js:1020:11)
    at exports._exceptionWithHostPort (util.js:1043:20)
    at _handle.lookup (dgram.js:219:18)
    at _combinedTickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:83:11)
    at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:104:9)
    at Module.runMain (module.js:606:11)
    at run (bootstrap_node.js:389:7)
    at startup (bootstrap_node.js:149:9)
    at bootstrap_node.js:504:3
  code: 'EACCES',
  errno: 'EACCES',
  syscall: 'bind',
  address: '0.0.0.0',
  port: 3000 }

If I shut down the VM and run my server outside of the container everything works fine.

I have my server set up so that it does not have exclusive binding set and reuseAddr is set to true when the websocket is created. This is why when I run it outside of the container there are no binding problems.

My question is: does port forwarding in VirtualBox do some sort of exclusive binding on the forwarded port? If so, can this be disabled? How can I run my server in a container if this happens?

UPDATE: I have discovered this only happens when I set VirtualBox to use UDP forwarding. TCP does not cause the issue. Is there any way to do UDP port forwarding and still be able to do port binding?

items.title: JavaScript: "TypeError: Illegal invocation" but I'm not calling any function
items.body:
Note: I've searched for this error, but everything I've found was about calling functions. I'm not calling any function. I'm just trying to access a property.

I get the error when I execute this simple code:

var a = document.getElementById("something");
var b = Object.create(a);
console.log(b.baseURI) //Throws error with any property of a
<p id="something">Hi! I exist just for demo purposes. This error can occur with any element.</p>

I have no idea of why this happens. The code works fine if I try to get the property from the prototype of b...

var a = document.getElementById("something");
var b = Object.create(a);
console.log( Object.getPrototypeOf(b.baseURI) ) //Works

... and also using a normal object.

var a = {foo: "Foo!"};
var b = Object.create(a);
console.log(b.foo) //Works

Why does this happen? It makes no sense to me. MDN says:

When trying to access a property of an object, the property will not only be sought on the object but on the prototype of the object, the prototype of the prototype, and so on until either a property with a matching name is found or the end of the prototype chain is reached.

The prototype chain of b (in the first example) is:

HTMLParagraphElement --> HTMLParagraphElement (the actual element object) --> HTMLParagraphElement --> HTMLElement --> Element --> Node --> EventTarget --> Object --> null

(Proof)

EDIT: Note how the 1st object in the proto chain is a HTMLParagraphElement. This is normal, so that's not the problem. (Image)

The problem (i think) is that the proprieties get kinda copied to the main b object and not just to b's prototype. This means that the browser founds a matching name right in the first object and tries to access it, but it throws an error. (Image; clicking the (...) results in error).

However, I still don't understand why this happens nor why the error is thrown.

But Laravel doesn't see it:

     Class 'AddInteractionsToVisits' not found

Am I doing something wrong? Is there a way to rollback module migration?

items.body_markdown:
There are two tasks to execute. For the first task, it executes for 2*0.2888=0.5776 time slots and repeat every 2 time slots. For the second task, it executes for 5*0.3010=1.505 and repeat every 5 time slots. For each task, we let them to execute at the end of period. For example, we let the first task to execute at the interval[1.4224, 2]. We start from the task with smallest period. We would like to construct the schedule table for both tasks in the interval [0, 10].

Here is the schedule table done by hand.
[enter image description here][1]


  [1]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/DOBYV.png

My question is how to draw the figure and table in Python?
items.title: Use Python to Construct Schedule Table
items.body:
There are two tasks to execute. For the first task, it executes for 2*0.2888=0.5776 time slots and repeat every 2 time slots. For the second task, it executes for 5*0.3010=1.505 and repeat every 5 time slots. For each task, we let them to execute at the end of period. For example, we let the first task to execute at the interval[1.4224, 2]. We start from the task with smallest period. We would like to construct the schedule table for both tasks in the interval [0, 10].

Here is the schedule table done by hand. enter image description here

My question is how to draw the figure and table in Python?

items.title: How to make vis.js lib to work with Angular2?
items.body:
I'm trying to use a visjs lib but can't make their getting started example working it goes like this:

<script type="text/javascript">
    // DOM element where the Timeline will be attached
    var container = document.getElementById('visualization');

    // Create a DataSet (allows two way data-binding)
    var items = new vis.DataSet([
        {id: 1, content: 'item 1', start: '2013-04-20'},
        {id: 2, content: 'item 2', start: '2013-04-14'},
        {id: 3, content: 'item 3', start: '2013-04-18'},
        {id: 4, content: 'item 4', start: '2013-04-16', end: '2013-04-19'},
        {id: 5, content: 'item 5', start: '2013-04-25'},
        {id: 6, content: 'item 6', start: '2013-04-27'}
    ]);

    // Configuration for the Timeline
    var options = {};

    // Create a Timeline
    var timeline = new vis.Timeline(container, items, options);
</script>

items.body_markdown:
I've used rpy2 to import R packages before but am having trouble using importr to import the R packages '**TTR**'
code is:


    import rpy2.robjects as robjects
    from rpy2.robjects import pandas2ri  # for dataframes
    pandas2ri.activate()
    from rpy2.robjects.packages import importr
    ttr = importr('TTR')


I'm getting Error as:


    rpy2.robjects.packages.LibraryError: The symbol .env in the package "TTR" is conflicting with a Python object attribute


I've seen similar question [rpy2 importr failing with xts and quantmod][1] but for package 'TTR', I don't know what parameter to give in `importr` parameter `robject_translations = ''`


  [1]: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13649562/rpy2-importr-failing-with-xts-and-quantmod
items.title: rpy2 importr failing with 'TTR' package
items.body:
I've used rpy2 to import R packages before but am having trouble using importr to import the R packages 'TTR' code is:

import rpy2.robjects as robjects
from rpy2.robjects import pandas2ri  # for dataframes
pandas2ri.activate()
from rpy2.robjects.packages import importr
ttr = importr('TTR')

I'm getting Error as:

rpy2.robjects.packages.LibraryError: The symbol .env in the package "TTR" is conflicting with a Python object attribute

I've seen similar question rpy2 importr failing with xts and quantmod but for package 'TTR', I don't know what parameter to give in importr parameter robject_translations = ''

items.body_markdown:
I'm doing some documentation in Markdown using Visual Studio Code. The problem is that I'm used to hard wrapping.

The only way I've found for setting hard wrapping in Visual Studio Code is by the EditorConfig extension. EditorConfig is not a Microsoft extension and sometimes you can see weird things happening such as wrapping some inline code (between backticks: ` `` `) for instance.

Is there some built-in way of setting hard wrapping in Visual Studio Code? If not, how do people set soft wrapping in Visual Studio Code in order to make Markdown look great (for instance, keep the indentation after a wrap in a bulleted list long paragraph)? Is it scheduled for a future release built-in hard-wrapping in Visual Studio Code?

Thanks

Update: In hard-wrapped text each new line is actually a line, has a different number. Soft wrapping is wrapping only for display: you change the viewport and lines changes, but each paragraph is just a line, a number ---as in VS Code.

Update2: You can hard wrap with the [VSCodeVim](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=vscodevim.vim) extension now the same way you wrap in Vim: <kbd>g</kbd>, <kbd>q</kbd>, <kbd>}</kbd> or any other combination with <kbd>g</kbd>, <kbd>q</kbd>.
items.title: Visual Studio Code built-in hard wrap
items.body:
I'm doing some documentation in Markdown using Visual Studio Code. The problem is that I'm used to hard wrapping.

The only way I've found for setting hard wrapping in Visual Studio Code is by the EditorConfig extension. EditorConfig is not a Microsoft extension and sometimes you can see weird things happening such as wrapping some inline code (between backticks: ``) for instance.

Is there some built-in way of setting hard wrapping in Visual Studio Code? If not, how do people set soft wrapping in Visual Studio Code in order to make Markdown look great (for instance, keep the indentation after a wrap in a bulleted list long paragraph)? Is it scheduled for a future release built-in hard-wrapping in Visual Studio Code?

Thanks

Update: In hard-wrapped text each new line is actually a line, has a different number. Soft wrapping is wrapping only for display: you change the viewport and lines changes, but each paragraph is just a line, a number ---as in VS Code.

Update2: You can hard wrap with the VSCodeVim extension now the same way you wrap in Vim: g, q, } or any other combination with g, q.

items.title: Custom infoWindow Google Maps IOS
items.body:
I customized a infoWindow, but this shows a infowindow default in the background. Is there a way to hide the infoWindow background? or that I'm doing wrong.

The code is:

func mapView(mapView: GMSMapView!, markerInfoContents marker: GMSMarker!) -> UIView! {
        if let infoView = UIView.viewFromNibName("MarkerInfoView") as? MarkerInfoView {
            infoView.lblTitle.text =  "Title" //marker.title
            infoView.lblDescription.text = "Description"
            infoView.lblDescription.numberOfLines = 0
            infoView.lblDescription.lineBreakMode = NSLineBreakMode.ByWordWrapping
            infoView.lblDescription.sizeToFit()
            return infoView
        } else {
            return nil
        }
    }

items.title: How to use TextContext to pull in a URL
items.body:
I appreciate there are a lot of answered questions on here relating to this, but having studied them and followed them, I'm still not quite clear where I am going wrong.

This for a c#/selenium QA test project. I have a .runsettings file at the route of my solution (same level as my config files). It includes the following:

  <Parameter name="EnvURL" value="www.google.com" />

I want to use this value to override a URL variable in my code, so that ultimately in the TFS build / run job, I can pass it various environment URLs depending on the parameter I set. I'm trying to initialise / use it as follows:

public class MonitoringHomePage : BasePage
{
    private MonitoringHomePage _homePage;
    private TestContext instance;

    public TestContext TestContext
    {
        set { instance = value; }
        get { return instance; }
    }

    public MonitoringHomePage(IWebDriver driver) : base(driver)
    {

    }

    //public override string Url => "https://www.google.com";

    public override string Url => instance.Properties["EnvURL"].ToString();
}

When I run my QA tests, the browser initialises, but doesn't navigate to google. It throws a 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object' error. With my limited c# knowledge, I thought I had initialised the testcontext instance above. Am I missing something with regards how textcontext needs initialising? Thanks in advance.
